alert.note: Alert for San Jacinto (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 4:05AM CST until January 09 at 5:45AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...While heavy rainfall has diminished, street and creek flooding across the warned area will continue to result in travel impacts as floodwaters recede. Between 4 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Liberty, Polk and San Jacinto. * WHEN...Until 800 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 405 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 4 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cleveland, Plum Grove, Kenefick, North Cleveland, Dayton Lakes, Tarkington Prairie, Romayor, Rye, Moss Hill and Segno. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
